Frequently Asked Questions



Here are some frequently asked questions about NatCam:

• How can I get NatCam?

Head on over to the Asset Store


• How does NatCam work?

NatCam gets the camera preview from the device camera and sends it to Unity. It also performs a lot of operations on the device cameras like focusing, zooming, and so on.


• What platforms does NatCam work on?

All platforms! Although NatCam was built primarily for iOS and Android, NatCam has a fallback API built in for other platforms. This means that you don't need to litter your project with platform-dependent code. If a feature is not supported by the fallback API, it will silently return.


• This looks like it could benefit my OpenCV app?

You are 100% correct. NatCam has built-in support for the OpenCVForUnity package, which streamlines the development of OpenCV apps. With NatCam's speed and efficiency, OpenCV apps see huge performance gains.


• Is there a place where I can ask further questions?

Yes. Head on over to the Unity forum or email me directly at olokobayusuf@gmail.com.


• I get build errors when building for Android because of duplicate google-play-services.jar

You probably use a plugin that already has google-play-services.jar. You can go ahead and delete NatCam's jar since there is already one in the project.


• I get linker errors when building for iOS.

Add Accelerate framework and AssetLibrary framework to your XCode project. This process was automated in NatCam v1.2f1.


• My gosh it's fast!

Exactly. Why don't you head on over to the Asset Store and leave a great review!


• I was just wondering, how did you make this amazing documentation?.

We created a documentation API called Calligraphy. We built it because of NatCam, but we will be using it for our subsequent API projects.
